str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To instruct orally, teach, inform. From kata and echos; to sound down into the ears, i.e. to indoctrinate or to apprise of.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To teach, direct, admonish. A prolonged form of a primary verb dao; to teach.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Jewish. From Iouda; Judaean, i.e. Belonging to Jehudah.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably from etho; a race, i.e. A tribe; specially, a foreign one.
Defection, apostasy, revolt. Feminine of the same as apostasion; defection from truth.
Or Moses, or Mouses of Hebrew origin; Moseus, Moses, or Mouses, the Hebrew lawgiver.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.
To cut around, circumcise. From peri and the base of tomoteros; to cut around, i.e. to circumcise.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A child, descendent, inhabitant. From the base of timoria; a child.
And not, not even, neither?nor. From me and de; but not, not even; in a continued negation, nor.
From peri and pateo; to tread all around, i.e. Walk at large; figuratively, to live, deport oneself, follow.
A custom, habit; an institute, rite. From etho; a usage.
